nodeList.name: Playing the animations and setting the Galaxy object's scale to make everything visible.

nodeList.name: Setting the Face Portal's scale to zero so it wont be visible.

nodeList.name: We will use the same technique as we did in the previous comment section to animate the Vignette power. This will make the edges of the screen appear darker as soon as a trigger occurs.
nodeList.defaultDisplayName: We will use the same technique as we did in the previous comment section to animate the Vignette power. This will make the edges of the screen appear darker as soon as a trigger occurs.

nodeList.name: Initiate the Alien showing up animation as soon as the trigger occurs.
nodeList.defaultDisplayName: Initiate the Alien showing up animation as soon as the trigger occurs.

nodeList.name: Start
nodeList.description: Execute the next node when an effect starts.

nodeList.name: Set Transform
nodeList.description: Set the position, rotation, and scale of an input Transform with the ability to toggle between local and world spaces.

nodeList.name: Set Transform
nodeList.description: Set the position, rotation, and scale of an input Transform with the ability to toggle between local and world spaces.

nodeList.name: Local Transform Info
nodeList.description: Get the local space position, rotation, and scale of a Transform component. If a Transform component is parented under another Transform component, it inherits the parent Transform component's local space coordinates.

nodeList.name: Local Transform Info
nodeList.description: Get the local space position, rotation, and scale of a Transform component. If a Transform component is parented under another Transform component, it inherits the parent Transform component's local space coordinates.

nodeList.name: If
nodeList.description: Take different executions based on conditions.

nodeList.description: Take different executions based on conditions.

nodeList.name: Transit by Time
nodeList.description: Transition from one value to another according to a certain interpolator within a certain time range. Supported types: Number, Vec2, Vec3, Vec4, and Color.

nodeList.name: Transit by Time
nodeList.description: Transition from one value to another according to a certain interpolator within a certain time range. Supported types: Number, Vec2, Vec3, Vec4, and Color.

nodeList.name: Get Component by Type
nodeList.description: Captures the specified component of a Scene Object

nodeList.name: Update
nodeList.description: Execute the next node in every frame.

nodeList.name: Wait for Seconds
nodeList.description: Take an execution after certain seconds.

nodeList.name: Set Component Property
nodeList.description: Set property value of a component

nodeList.name: Screen Tap
nodeList.description: Execute the next node when the device screen is tapped. It is executed as soon as the finger touches the device screen.

nodeList.name: Start
nodeList.description: Execute the next node when an effect starts.

nodeList.name: Video Record
nodeList.description: Execute the next node when recording. By default, in desktop tool preview, it is always recording.

nodeList.name: If
nodeList.description: Take different executions based on conditions.

nodeList.name: If

nodeList.name: Facial Movement Detection
nodeList.description: Detect the movement on face. Each movement has four states: Begin, Stay, End, and None. For movement such as eye blink, even the fastest blink has one frame "Stay" state. To detect facial movement more than one face, assign a Face Movement Detection node to each face in the scene. It can detect up to five facial movements.

nodeList.name: Facial Movement Detection
nodeList.description: Detect the movement on face. Each movement has four states: Begin, Stay, End, and None. For movement such as eye blink, even the fastest blink has one frame "Stay" state. To detect facial movement more than one face, assign a Face Movement Detection node to each face in the scene. It can detect up to five facial movements.
